'Ctrl' is an American comedy web series of NBC. It is the first stand-alone web
series launched by a major television network. The series stars Tony
Hale (of [[Arrested Development (TV series)|Arrested Development]]) as a typical
office-working, self-confidence lacking nerd who discovers he can undo things
(as well as employ other keyboard functions) in real life.

It is an adaptation and expansion of the short film [[Ctrl Z (short film)|Ctrl
Z]] by director Robert Kirbyson which was a winner at the Sundance Film
Festival in 2008.

CTRL was spotted and developed by SXM from the original short film CTRL Z which
screened at the Sundance Film Festival in 2008. SXM ultimately partnered with
NBC's digital studio to produce the online series. After NBC shut the digital
studio in 2011 all rights reverted back to SXM who are currently developing
Season 2 with Yahoo and a private investor.

As of early 2012, the episodes appear to have been removed from the NBC website,
but can be found on Hulu.
